Medicine_92_r.News Finding: Declines in the frequency of vaginal and oral sexual behaviors occurred irrespective of tumor HPV status.
Medicine_92_r.Paper Finding: Awareness of this link between sexual behavior, oral HPV infection, and cancer may cause concern for patients who have HPV-positive OSCC and their partners.
Medicine_92_r.News Context: Investigators also found that abstinence from vaginal sex significantly increased from 10% at baseline to 34% at 6 months (P <.01) and abstinence from oral sex increased from 25% to 80% (P <.01). Declines in the frequency of vaginal and oral sexual behaviors occurred irrespective of tumor HPV status. The findings ultimately suggest that a diagnosis of oropharyngeal cancer can have significant negative effects on sexual behavior.
Medicine_92_r.Paper Context: Performing oral sex increases the risk of oral HPV infection, and the risk increases with the number of partners. Awareness of this link between sexual behavior, oral HPV infection, and cancer may cause concern for patients who have HPV-positive OSCC and their partners. Strong associations are observed between sexual behavior, oral HPV infection, and oropharyngeal cancer.
Medicine_92_r.text: ['Finding: Declines in the frequency of vaginal and oral sexual behaviors occurred irrespective of tumor HPV status.']
Medicine_92_r.displayed_text: Finding: Declines in the frequency of vaginal and oral sexual behaviors occurred irrespective of tumor HPV status.

Medicine_tweet_74_r.News Finding: Parent conversations with children about their weight associated with disordered eating behaviours
Medicine_tweet_74_r.Paper Finding: This study builds on recent research focusing on fathers and their role in adolescent eating disorders treatment 32, [41] [42] [43] and finds that adolescents whose fathers engaged in weight conversations were significantly more likely to engage in dieting and UWCBs than adolescents whose fathers did not.
Medicine_tweet_74_r.News Context: Parent conversations with children about their weight associated with disordered eating behaviours
Medicine_tweet_74_r.Paper Context: This approach may be particularly important for parents of overweight or obese adolescents. This study builds on recent research focusing on fathers and their role in adolescent eating disorders treatment 32, [41] [42] [43] and finds that adolescents whose fathers engaged in weight conversations were significantly more likely to engage in dieting and UWCBs than adolescents whose fathers did not. Thus, it may be important to educate fathers to avoid any form of weight-related conversations with their adolescents.
Medicine_tweet_74_r.text: ['Finding: Parent conversations with children about their weight associated with disordered eating behaviours ']
Medicine_tweet_74_r.displayed_text: Finding: Parent conversations with children about their weight associated with disordered eating behaviours

Medicine_tweet_22_r.News Finding: #medicalresearch The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot osteoarthritis in community-dwelling...
Medicine_tweet_22_r.Paper Finding: The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot OA in adults aged 50 years and over was 16.7% (95% CI 15.3% to 18.0%).
Medicine_tweet_22_r.News Context: #medicalresearch The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot osteoarthritis in community-dwelling...
Medicine_tweet_22_r.Paper Context: Population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot OA Population prevalence estimates were almost identical in the baseline responder population and the total baseline eligible mailed population, hence the latter data are presented. The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot OA in adults aged 50 years and over was 16.7% (95% CI 15.3% to 18.0%). The most commonly affected joint was the 1st MTPJ (7.8%; 95% CI 6.7% to 8.9%), followed by the 2nd CMJ (6.8%; 95% CI 5.7% to 7.8%), TNJ (5.8%; 95% CI 4.8% to 6.9%), NCJ (5.2%; 95% CI 4.0% to 6.4%) and 1st CMJ (3.9%; 95% CI 2.9% to 4.9%) (table 3) .
Medicine_tweet_22_r.text: ['Finding: #medicalresearch The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot osteoarthritis in community-dwelling... ']
Medicine_tweet_22_r.displayed_text: Finding: #medicalresearch The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot osteoarthritis in community-dwelling...

Medicine_507_r.News Finding: The researchers found that when the seals put on enough fat to achieve neutral buoyancy, the number of strokes needed to complete a round-trip from bottom to surface was at its lowest.
Medicine_507_r.Paper Finding: Seals gradually became more buoyant as they increased their fat stores while foraging over the course of the migration.
Medicine_507_r.News Context: This means that she's negatively buoyant when she heads back out to sea and can sink into the deep water without swimming very hard. The researchers found that when the seals put on enough fat to achieve neutral buoyancy, the number of strokes needed to complete a round-trip from bottom to surface was at its lowest. "At neutral buoyancy, they're able to spend more time foraging at depth because they're spending less energy moving up and down," said Costa.
Medicine_507_r.Paper Context: At the start of each migration, all 14 seals were negatively buoyant, as indicated by the negative drift rate values (figure 1; electronic supplementary material, figure S3 ). Seals gradually became more buoyant as they increased their fat stores while foraging over the course of the migration. All seals were still negatively buoyant at the end of the short foraging migration, but five of seven seals became neutrally buoyant by the end of the recording period during the long foraging migration, as indicated by the drift rates being zero (i.e.
Medicine_507_r.text: ['Finding: The researchers found that when the seals put on enough fat to achieve neutral buoyancy, the number of strokes needed to complete a round-trip from bottom to surface was at its lowest.']
Medicine_507_r.displayed_text: Finding: The researchers found that when the seals put on enough fat to achieve neutral buoyancy, the number of strokes needed to complete a round-trip from bottom to surface was at its lowest.

Medicine_294_r.News Finding: These findings do not support the use of otamixaban for patients with NSTE-ACS undergoing planned early percutaneous coronary intervention," the authors conclude.
Medicine_294_r.Paper Finding: At that time, the rates of the primary efficacy outcome in the higher-dose otamixaban group was 4.7% (the one selected to go forward) and was 5.6% in the UFH-pluseptifibatide group (adjusted RR, 0.848; 95% CI, 0.662-1.087) but the lower-dose group fulfilled the prespecified criteria for futility with a RR of more than 1 (primary efficacy outcome, 6.3%; RR, 1.130; 95% CI, 0.906-1.408) and was discontinued.
Medicine_294_r.News Context: Study anticoagulant was discontinued because of bleeding in 242 patients (4.7 percent) in the otamixaban group and in 95 patients (1.7 percent) in the UFH-plus-eptifibatide group. "Otamixaban did not reduce ischemic events compared with UFH plus eptifibatide but increased bleeding among patients with NSTE-ACS and a planned invasive strategy. These findings do not support the use of otamixaban for patients with NSTE-ACS undergoing planned early percutaneous coronary intervention," the authors conclude.
Medicine_294_r.Paper Context: The design of the TAO trial has been published. At that time, the rates of the primary efficacy outcome in the higher-dose otamixaban group was 4.7% (the one selected to go forward) and was 5.6% in the UFH-pluseptifibatide group (adjusted RR, 0.848; 95% CI, 0.662-1.087) but the lower-dose group fulfilled the prespecified criteria for futility with a RR of more than 1 (primary efficacy outcome, 6.3%; RR, 1.130; 95% CI, 0.906-1.408) and was discontinued. Events occurring among patients who received the discontinued otamixaban dose were not considered in primary outcome analyses, which pertained only to participants randomized to the higher dose of otamixaban vs UFH plus eptifibatide, not to the low-dose otamixaban group.
Medicine_294_r.text: ['Finding: These findings do not support the use of otamixaban for patients with NSTE-ACS undergoing planned early percutaneous coronary intervention," the authors conclude.']
Medicine_294_r.displayed_text: Finding: These findings do not support the use of otamixaban for patients with NSTE-ACS undergoing planned early percutaneous coronary intervention," the authors conclude.

Medicine_tweet_37_r.News Finding:
A healthy diet seems to most benefit people with a genetic predisposition to #obesity
 @username #OA
Medicine_tweet_37_r.Paper Finding: Moreover, the beneficial effect of improved diet quality on weight management was particularly pronounced in people at high genetic risk for obesity.
Medicine_tweet_37_r.News Context:
A healthy diet seems to most benefit people with a genetic predisposition to #obesity
 @username #OA
Medicine_tweet_37_r.Paper Context: These data indicate that improving adherence to healthy dietary patterns could attenuate the genetic association with weight gain. Moreover, the beneficial effect of improved diet quality on weight management was particularly pronounced in people at high genetic risk for obesity. Weights reported in questionnaires and measured by technicians were highly correlated (r=0.97 in both studies) in a validation subsample.
Medicine_tweet_37_r.text: ['Finding: A healthy diet seems to most benefit people with a genetic predisposition to #obesity\n @username #OA ']
Medicine_tweet_37_r.displayed_text: Finding: A healthy diet seems to most benefit people with a genetic predisposition to #obesity @username #OA
